titleStmt.title: Minutes of the TEI Technical Council
titleStmt.meeting: TEI Technical Council online meeting : 8 July 2022

sourceDesc.p: Retagged from a WordPress HTML file

revisionDesc.change: Extracted from Word Press article with id post-31350

list.item:
F2F meeting in Newcastle
September 11–13 (Sun–Tue).
Agenda F2F meeting
Travel + Accommodation
MS reminds us to book soon! Newcastle is already booking fast
Invitations
James Cummings
David Maus — declined
Martin Holmes — looking forward

Joint Board/Council meeting
Monday afternoon at 17:30, dinner afterwards
Release techs will be SS, PS, & MS. (Making this an all-European effort.)
Link in the email sent today does not work. ACTION on MS to resend with correct link.
SB reports link from Mon 04 Jul mail to TEI-L works (and confirms the link from the 05:49 mail this morning does not)
Do we wait to merge into dev until after the conference? SB says no. It will be ready to go after we fix the egregious but trivially fixed error in the order of datatypes. See the review by SB.
Action on SB, HC, MS: Review PR 2299 by 2022-06-24
Action on HC and EBB to update the prose by mid-July.
Action on HC, SB, or EBB after prose updated: make PR for the branch.

Discussion of the word “chunk” which isn’t easy to translate. Yet it has been with the Guidelines for a long time, and is all over the Guidelines. Original analogy was to soup with “chunks” floating in broth.

Areas that we know need updating include:
STBTC
COPA (which is seriously problematic, particularly the first sentence with its totalizing assumptions about paragraphs)
Yes. Action on MS to add this to the documentation repo.
It is SB’s job this month.
Request PS to send a report on his automated method — progress, or has he given up? ACTION on MS to ask PS.
Group worked on the gender ticket (#2189) and on (#2132).
Returning to Newcastle, EBB requests that we share information about accommodation (beyond what conference organizers provide). Put info in the document where we are organizing the agenda.

cell.p: Reach out to the TEI community at and after the conference.
Translation into German, Action on MS and SS

div.head: Issues from the October 2021 meeting
div.p: Issues from the October meeting discussed by group B (European Group: MS, PS, MT, HBS) but on which no final decision was by the plenary.

cell.ref: Additional version/date attributes for gaiji description

cell.p: into att.schemeDef with attributes @scheme and @schemeVersion, eg. CSS 2.1 and Unicode 12.0 and change the @schemeVersion datatype teidata.versionNumber to accommodate e.g semver ranges like >=1.2.7 <1.3.0; alternatively @maxVersion @minVersion

2022-07-08 Council discussion: There are 5 different versions of @version, and also @schemeVersion. Should we introduce datatype:semanticVersion with a datatype to accommodate semantic version ranges? Or introduce an alternative definition of @version att.gaijiprop. As for otherVer, no. Just put @version on another element. Change @version attribute so that it can support ranges.
We will work on it in a branch and then engage 747 again.
ACTION on SB, MS, and Martin Holmes
subgroup recommends to deprecate @org on attList and use schematron rules instead. A few elements use <attList org=””> at the moment, e.g. relation. These would have to be re-written.

————– There is no comment on the ticket to this effect, so I (SB) am commenting here. I think this [using Schematron instead] is a terrible idea. One can express this (alternation of attributes) in RELAX NG, XML Schema, and even in ODD (except that it does not work in classes). There is no reason it should not remain expressible in ODD.
